website_summaries.verdict: A shockproof stainless steel dial caliper that will last you for years to come if it is cared for correctly.
pros: Comes with a fitted case for storage
Measures lengths up to six inches
Resistant to shocks, like being dropped on the floor
Easy to get an accurate reading
cons: This caliper doesn't adjust as smoothly as some users would like

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have used micrometers for over 30 years. At one time in my career I taught proper use of precision measuring instruments to union workers in a high precision machine shop. There are better quality products on the market and you probably know the brand names. The Fowler is a great product for the price. I bought it for my daughter who is a school teacher that teaches technical subjects to her students. She uses the Fowler in her class to teach precision measuring to her students. It has worked flawlessly for her despite being utilized by many unskilled students.
customer_reviews.author: Jerbear

customer_reviews.title: These are definitely not of flimsy construction like sporting good store brands
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical due to the price but thought I would give it a shot before dropping $200 on Starrett etc. These are definitely not of flimsy construction like sporting good store brands. The first thing I noticed was their weight and rigid feel, just like high end calipers. I have been using them almost everyday for months and they are accurate and zero still indicates perfectly at twelve o'clock. The case they come in is very nice and can be opened easily with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: chase fisher

customer_reviews.title: I've tested it on some gage blocks and some 1-2-3 blocks that I have and it checks out just fine so far
customer_reviews.text: The movement action was quite stiff when I first got it but it's loosened up significantly. I've tested it on some gage blocks and some 1-2-3 blocks that I have and it checks out just fine so far. I got it as a backup caliper for my Mitutoyo and it works great (so far). I will note that the first set of these that I got about 6 years ago got dropped a couple times and they quickly started skipping gears and getting locked/bound up. I know it says "shockproof" but don't be fooled, any set of dial calipers can be quickly broken with a few hard shocks.
customer_reviews.author: hedfones

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Far more accurate then any and I mean any digital aproximater. I just got it recently so can not address its longevity but as of now. What I can tell you is that it has a robust well built feel about it and it’s dead nut balls on accurate. Right out of its relatively nice case the action was just a bit stiff but has gotten smoother with use. I’ll never use my 190 $. American made digital close enough calipers again.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Conversion chart could be more helpful
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and precision. It came perfectly zeroed (within a thousandths of an inch when measuring a 9mm industrial ruby tip). The conversion chart looks to be for tool sizes -- mostly metric. It would be nice if they replaced it with a decimal to standard and standard to metric conversions. My calipers were for standard measurements. So, the metric tool tip chart is not very helpful without those conversions.
customer_reviews.author: worldDominator2041

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a handful of times so far, but it outshines my plastic Empire caliper and my cheapo HF pair by miles. Sturdy, accurate, and smooth. Great buy for somebody who really can't justify paying $30 more or even 2x more for a Starrett or Mitutoyo tool.
customer_reviews.author: Darsh

customer_reviews.title: measurement system is off right off the bat
customer_reviews.text: The main issue I am having is that when the caliper is fully closed the dial indicator is at zero which is fine. The issue is that the measurement graph under the dial does not line up in the jaws of caliper. Which throws you off visually. If I could attach photos I would. I have had better luck with my Fowler outside mic, but I didn't think this would happen with this dial caliper. This was going to go into my work tool box, but not any more.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Gibson

customer_reviews.title: great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Is it as smooth as my Mitutoyo caliper? No. But it gives accurate and repeatable measurements for about a quarter of the price. I measured some grade 1000 ball bearings and got consistent, accurate readings. Six readings were all within 0.001" (+/- 0.0005) of the original measurement. Measurements at the base of the jaws matched those from the ends, indicating the jaws are accurately parallel. Update three years later. I dropped it about 12". Now it works like the people who voted one star! Now it is only useful as a go/no-go gauge. Shop Tip: Don't drop your dial caliper :(
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: For a dial caliper, this is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.text: I use calipers at work all of the time. I like digital ones and I am very picky about quality. Fowler has always impressed me with all of their precision measuring tools. I bought this new for my occasional use at home. I don't use it often so I am sure that the battery would be dead every time I would get it out. That is why I went with this dial caliper. It seems to be accurate and well made. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: great caliper
customer_reviews.text: I needed another caliper for my new shop and this one works perfectly. Unless you use the digital ones alot its not worth the hassle to have it sitting in a drawer and the battery goes dead. This one is always ready to go. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: A. different Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice.
customer_reviews.text: These things are really fantastic. The action is smooth, no lash in the gears and looks great. The case works well and seems like it will last a lifetime with careful handling. As with any precision instrument, I make sure it isn't going to fall, no it's box. I see nothing about these dial calipers that is not perfect quality. I haven't tested the "shockproofness," neither am I going to let that happen. Well worth the $30! I would have paid $50. This was a 2-beer-sip review.
customer_reviews.author: Rootfire

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same calipers about 12 yrs ago. Mine still work, these were a gift. Much better case this time around. Very smooth slide
customer_reviews.author: Confederate preacher

customer_reviews.title: Fowler dial caliper
customer_reviews.text: The nice thing about this caliber is it stainless steel for the little bit that I use it for it works great. I measure certain diameter objects from time to time but I used it very little but I recommend this product. I don’t have any negatives that I came across.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: nice heavy duty tool
customer_reviews.text: they work great and right on, put some light oil the are a little stiff at first but get smoother after use.
customer_reviews.author: DARRELL G.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: As a professional machinist I was surprised at the quality of this caliper. Made a new customer out of me. The much more expensive ones I have been using for years have gone down in quality some much they just are not worth it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: A bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent calipers. Extremely well made with pinpoint accuracy. You can spend a lot more money but I think you’d be hard pressed to find a better built caliper for twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: FFournier

customer_reviews.title: very precise with consistent readings! I would never change ...
customer_reviews.text: very precise with consistent readings! I would never change this analog for a digital one. Used it for measuring shims for my ring gear and pinion along with a solid spacer for bearing preload. Working flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.author: Erick T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've done a lot of machine work over the years, and for the money this is an excellent very accurate dial caliper. I would buy it again in a heart beat!
customer_reviews.author: Thricestripe

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: If these ever break or start to go downhill, the warranty will take care of it. Use them at work everyday and have never let me down. Great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: Came useable but dial was suck and I ended up replacing them
customer_reviews.author: mike mclintock

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your's or Amazon's time on this item
customer_reviews.text: Movement rough and gritty. When I closed back to zero the whole dial face had turned 45 degrees left instead of staying at 12 o'clock position as it should. The locking screw for setting zero was crooked and off center. Totally useless right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Used more than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I'm doing more auto repairs myself and needed a more accurate means of measuring things. Measurements are very consistent. Tested it on a few feeler gauges and it was pretty much spot on. Came in a nice storage case for protection. Found myself using this more often than I anticipated (for non critical measurements). Now I can easily measure things very accurately instead of trying to eyeball things with a measuring tape. Would of given this five stars if the inner jaw was a little deeper so I can measure items with a raised outer edge.
customer_reviews.author: Onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Holds zero very well. Has survived being bumped off milling table. Good accuracy, especially for student shops. I'm very happy with these. Smooth operation also. Great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: jeremyva

customer_reviews.title: Nice calipers
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional fabricator and use verniers ( ok dial calipers) regularly. Fowler set functions well and the one revolution per 100 thousandths dial makes for easier reading. This was less expensive than the B&S, the Starret and Mitutoyo but the function is everything it needs to be for precision work.
customer_reviews.author: LekceUS

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until loaned to a co-worker who broke or dropped ...
customer_reviews.text: Passed calibration 2x. It worked great until loaned to a co-worker who broke or dropped it. Only giving 4 stars because its not not made in US, UK, or EU. I try not to buy tools made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive caliper - not a the most expensive but ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive caliper - not a the most expensive but it snaps right back to zero every time no dial creep [unless its dirty] action is smooth and the measurements accurate - no cheap plastic parts to break - for the price I got more than I paid for - would recommend to anyone..
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Use them at work in a job shop. Digital to much money for one that can handle getting coolant on them. Bought these because cheaper set came unglued on rack gear, these have screws to hold it in place. They repeat measurements real well. Don't expect them to feel like a hundred dollar set.
customer_reviews.author: david peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this caliper after returning another comparable Chinese made version. This one is leagues better. Smooth in operation and consistent. Holds zero every time I close it back up. The case is decent and I would easily recommend this for an entry level caliper. I used this in a machining class and it has server me well.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Slowinski

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this Dial Caliper can't be beat. Solid steel, put together well and has smooth operation. I checked it against some other measuring devices and was within 3/10000. Easy to read dial. It'll get lots of use around my workshop. The only down side is that it's made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: My husband is an auto mechanic. He ordered this ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an auto mechanic. He ordered this for work and loves it bc it will last forever and doesn't need batteries or to be charged.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Not enough protection during shipment
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved my 0-6 calipers i was disappointed to find that the plastic cover over the dial was damaged before i even opened the box
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fowler 72-008-706 6" caliper
customer_reviews.text: I use calipers for reloading and I like to have a couple on hand to do different tasks. I am pleased with this caliper, the overall quality is good. I checked it against my "older" Browne & Sharpe caliper and they both read the same. It is not quite as smooth as my B&S but it is accurate and consistent.
customer_reviews.author: wmdshooter

customer_reviews.title: China quality. Don’t buy. Not the same as picture.
customer_reviews.text: Have other sets of Fowler calipers and they work great but the ones I received when I ordered these have a rough slide and are not the ones pictured. Case is junk and cheap and not the one pictured either.
customer_reviews.author: Drew putt

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: No calibration records and when I opened them they were not even at zero showed .05 when it should have been at 0
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the beginner or at home in the shop
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and well made. Good value for the money. As some of the reviews stated they don't slide as smooth as the high dollars calipers but what do you expect for 55 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L Ortmann

customer_reviews.title: Good caliper
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality for good price. I am accomplished machinist and this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Perseus

customer_reviews.title: A very good pair of calipers
customer_reviews.text: A very good pair of calipers. Checked against test blocks same measurement every time. Return to zero. Very happy with these and a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: robert dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't need batteries
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, kind of wish I'd of purchased the one with dual scales, metric and imperial. Good tool though
customer_reviews.author: Brian Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great product made of quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Great product made of quality materials. Shipper did all they said they would do in the time they said they would do it. I would shop there again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Work exactly as advertised. Truly shock-proof. Dropped a few times, no visible damage, no loss of zero. Also, there aren't any burrs or rough surfaces. These calipers were machined well and made from good steel.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The calipers are good quality and were delivered on time as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Wallyhound

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: If you are proud of your product, why not say where it was made?
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Smitherson

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. Very gritty and rough movement. I have a $9 Harbor Freight caliper which is much smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: These are the smoothest dial calipers I have felt this side of Tesa (Browne & Sharpe). Made in China, yes, but that does not mean the quality has to be bad. These don't have the finish of Swiss made or even Mitutoyo, but better than expected and quite acceptable. Calipers were dead nuts accurate checking with 1-, 2-, & 3-inch micrometer standards. These will make great every day calipers in my machine shop .
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W Hauff

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had a chance to use it much, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it much, but appears to be accurate and smooth as to the way I use these.
customer_reviews.author: Diacis

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for general purpose use
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be well within .001" accurate. I've run it for a few years for reloading ammo, and it's good for loading match ammo, and any other misc measurements I need to take.
customer_reviews.author: M. MANNHEIMER

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: It's worked great for me so far. I use it to measure my reload casings and it's been dead on and it holds its zero. I like that it's metal and solid, compared to the plastic ones out there. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cory K.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Fowler quality stands up well to Starrett or Mitutoyo on this dial caliper. I had one for 25 years that performed accurately. Unfortunately I lost it and had to replace it. New one is identical to the old one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Work like a charm. Solid feel. Accurate and dependable. Great case, as well.
customer_reviews.author: ChristoStad

customer_reviews.title: These aren't bad however the dial doesn't turn and they are off ...
customer_reviews.text: These aren't bad however the dial doesn't turn and they are off by about .002. But the .002 comes and goes so i have to check my part 4-5 times. I only use them for school but if they were for work i would be pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Bognacki

customer_reviews.title: Great caliper for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for measuring shim stacks of differentials. It came in a nice blow-molded case and coated in a protective coat of oil. It works great, accuracy seems to be right on and the tool operates tightly, not sloppy and cheap feeling. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 40 year old pair of mitutoyo verniers. Quality should last till retirement.
customer_reviews.author: pete b

customer_reviews.title: 000 so works great for
customer_reviews.text: I use these everyday for my job and they must be within .001 of our tests and they were within.000 so works great for me
customer_reviews.author: Rippa

customer_reviews.title: excellent value
customer_reviews.text: These scales have proven to be a very great value for the price. For what I am using these for I am more interested in precise measurements. Accuracy has been great also, but the consistency measurements has been great. I will definitely be buying more Fowler products next time i need measurement tools.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great and doesn't feel cheap like the ones from harbor ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and doesn't feel cheap like the ones from harbor freight. On mine, the needle lines up at the 12 o'clock position when fully closed to zero.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for reloading and shop measurements - - very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Alroc06

customer_reviews.title: Great Caliper
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a shop class for college. This Dial Caliper is a great tool for now and them use. It was very accurate I checked it with some gauge blocks and it was dead on. The case is not the best one out there but for a free case it protects the caliper and at the end of the day that is all that matters. I found the caliper to be pretty smooth. The Caliper is not as nice as the Mitutoyo caliper but then again it cost several times more. I would go with a Fowler or a Mitutoyo Caliper you can't go wrong. Don't waste your money on any off brands.
customer_reviews.author: cash

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the price. It takes accurate measurements and slides smooth on the bar. Great tool for any beginner machinist, or just for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: i use this at work all the time. provides accurate measurements where appropriate. It is of sufficient quality for a professional environment.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. Spend the extra money and get a
customer_reviews.text: Cheap build and feel. Would not recommend. Spend the extra money and get a Mitutoyo
customer_reviews.author: Umit Erol

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Received in good condition and calibrated after it acclimated. It was spot on and for the price, has been a great tool that does what's it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it should small hiccup doesn't always move super smooth but stays accurate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good calipers for any application.
customer_reviews.text: These are quality calipers that rival those costing several $100. I am using them in my home shop, but would not hesitate to use them at work.
customer_reviews.author: Ingeniero1

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great caliper. I've got a frankford arsenal that uses batteries. I prefer this one. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice caliper. Easy to read, smooth action. would recommend product and seller to friends.
customer_reviews.author: zootallures

customer_reviews.title: Best Dial Caliper for the money
customer_reviews.text: This Caliper is built very well, no corners cut on the finish or functionality. Provides accurate measurments, is easily adjustable and returns to zero every time. Picking it up you wouldn't think it was a 30 dollar caliper. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: kenneth welch

customer_reviews.title: used to order a bearing for a motor works great
customer_reviews.text: used to order a bearing for a motor works great thanks
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T.

customer_reviews.title: Fowler Dial Caliper (Buy it)
customer_reviews.text: Great dial caliper, accurate, good quality metal, and looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: John Perrone Jr

customer_reviews.title: Got exactly what I wanted and expected
customer_reviews.text: I like good quality tools. There is an old saying, buy good tools, take care of them and they'll take care of you. I have used the high end instruments and they are without a doubt great. I wanted the best I could find on a budget and Fowler has met that need. How well they hold up over the long run remains to be seen... but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Garsner

customer_reviews.title: Tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he was very Pleased with the quality. Made a good birthday present! Great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ina Miller

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Have had 4 pairs last pair is junk not sure if there quality went down hill or just got a bad pair this pair does not repeat well
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent quality, I use it often and it never fails me
customer_reviews.author: the submachinest

customer_reviews.title: not worth buying, made in china, the needle ...
customer_reviews.text: not worth buying, made in china, the needle was broke off when i opened the package. save your money & buy a brown& sharpe when you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product considering it is coming from China. I use it as a beater, and love the dial.
customer_reviews.author: Soumya

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a good product
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the product and I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality of the old Brown & Sharpe I dropped and broke but very good for the price. Accurate enough for my wood working projects. I reccommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I found this set of calipers to be very good. Guaranteed tolerances are very close for a set ...
customer_reviews.text: I found this set of calipers to be very good. Guaranteed tolerances are very close for a set of calipers, they guarantee plus or minus .0005 ", I found this to be true when used at my work.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Santamaria

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Built well, easy to use, does the job. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Toby W.

customer_reviews.title: Fowler is a great product
customer_reviews.text: As a machinist these are great calipers for most measuring tasks. We use them in our shop and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this professionally and it stays calibrated, and gives consistent readings at all times. Very good materials and machining.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan R

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Caliper was exactly what I expected. Well machined and with all the features advertised. Would definitely recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for our son....very well received and much loved....already in use in his job as a cabinetmaker AND in his restoration of an old victorian home with great bones! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee N. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: The lid won't even stay closed so it is pretty useless. Overall
customer_reviews.text: This product was disappointing. I have to reset the zero about half of the times I take a measurement. Makes me question the accuracy. The case is not what is shown in the images and what is described in the other reviews. The case delivered with the calipers is translucent, cheap plastic with no foam insert. The lid won't even stay closed so it is pretty useless. Overall, I was disappointed after seeing all of the good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: Not the high dollar name brand but very dependle and heavy duty. I use it inside machines at the shop where I work. Very easy to use and read
customer_reviews.author: jeff bronson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for the money. Smooth opperation, delivered on time, works well as adertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm measuring everything in the house! Nothing is too small... but it could be too large... that is all. ts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great for home use and not as costly as Starrett.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Economy at it's finest!
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool just about everyday and I trust the Fowler brand to give me the accuracy which my job demands.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gwynne-Pattison

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was very fast and I recieved it much quicker than expected. Movement is not as smooth as I would like but overall it is not bad for the price. The case is okay but certainly not anything to rave about. Accuracy is fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soni

customer_reviews.title: Well made precise caliper
customer_reviews.text: This product met my expectations in all areas. It was well made, advertised at a good precise, and works beautifully for my craftwork
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Gellie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool for the money... Accurate a smooth, can't ask for much more
customer_reviews.author: Joel sauter

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works very very well for what i need it for. Its gets 4 out of five stars only because it is not made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Lew

customer_reviews.title: Really nice Dial Caliper.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice Dial Caliper. I use it in locksmithing, measuring keys, tumblers, locks, ect. Easy to use, Do not drop it,
customer_reviews.author: Big AL

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price and Made in USA with all the original Fowler quality!
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA, and today's price is HALF of what the same size Mit cost ten years ago! #MAGA!
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Smooth but
customer_reviews.text: Not very rugged the worst calipers I've owned in 30 years. They locked up for no reason after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: steve timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good for cheap crap, but no brown and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Manage your expectations with these. On mine the ID and OD portions differ by about .001. That said I wasn't expecting these to be very good, and they aren't. They don't slide smoothly, due to bad finishing of the surfaces. They are however stainless, which means they can be used on Nuke jobs and they are cheap, which means you won't worry about destroying them like you do with a $200 set of brown and sharp. Best of the cheap asian made POS tools though. Certainly way above most of the stuff you get from china.
customer_reviews.author: Polybun

product_meta.title: Fowler Full Warranty Stainless Steel Shockproof Dial Caliper, 52-008-706-0, 0-6" Measuring Range, 0.001" Graduation Interval, Face Color White
product_meta.description:
The Fowler Shockproof stainless steel dial caliper has dial graduations of 0.001" with 0.001" accuracy, shockproof anti-backlash control, a sliding jaw with a lock, and a covered rack. This caliper is used for measuring inside dimensions (ID), outside dimensions (OD), depth, and step. This product has a 1 year warranty offered by Fowler High Precision. If you experience any problem contact Fowler directly for warranty claims. 

Shockproof spring anti-backlash control with a heavy-duty spring offers increased accuracy over standard gear configurations. Backlash is the amount of clearance between mated gear teeth in the caliper controls that prevents the gear teeth from jamming. It is undesirable to have much backlash due to the lack of precision offered by the increased amount of play between gears. Certain gear designs can minimize or eliminate backlash; spring anti-backlash systems use a spring to add a compressive force, thereby minimizing backlash. 

This caliper has a knurled lock screw to hold the sliding jaw in position and help ensure a consistent measurement. A covered rack prevents dirt and debris from clogging the gear, and helps prevent measurement errors. A thumb-operated fine adjustment roller allows for one-handed use. 

The caliper measures 0.10" per revolution of the dial. The dial has 0.001" graduations, and the beam has engraved 0.1" graduations. The hardened stainless steel components, including the beam, measuring surfaces, rack, gears, and depth rod, offer corrosion resistance, increased accuracy, and long life. Self-contained movement eliminates gear misalignment, while the dual pinion drive mechanism reduces wear on the rack and pinion. An adjustable dial enables setting zero. The hardened stainless steel is polished to a satin chrome finish, to help prevent glare. This caliper comes with a fitted case. 

Dial calipers are measuring instruments commonly used for inspection in manufacturing to provide the precise measurements of an object. A pair of jaws attached to a long beam with a marked scale is used to measure inside, outside, and step measurements in standard or metric units. An additional depth probe slides along the beam to take depth measurements. One jaw is fixed to the end of the scale, while the other jaw slides along it to take measurements. A circular dial indicator is fixed to the movable jaw on a toothed gear rack that transfers movement of the jaws to the dial needle. The base measurement is taken from the long beam, which provides the initial whole measurement in inches or centimeters, and added to the dial reading, which provides fractional measurements in inches or millimeters. A locking mechanism provides the ability to take differential measurements for determining the difference in measurements between two objects. Compared to digital calipers, dial calipers are more durable, but are more susceptible to shock damage and prone to getting dirt in the gears, which can cause accuracy problems. Vernier calipers are more durable than dial calipers because they do not have internal moving parts, but they can be more difficult to read. Dial calipers are commonly used in fields such as metalworking, mechanical engineering, machining, and carpentry. 

Fowler, an American company, manufactures inspection and measurement instruments such as electronic indicators, calipers, bore gages, and digital scales. The company, founded in 1946, is headquartered in Newton, MA. 


What's in the Box?
• Fowler Shockproof 0-6” dial caliper
• Fitted case
